result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad M Ellertson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chad M Ellertson appeared by video.  Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus appeared by video for Chad M Ellertson.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery from the State and requests a plea hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Chad M Ellertson appeared by video.  Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus appeared by video for Chad M Ellertson.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz for Mallory Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad M Ellertson in court.  Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus in court for Chad M Ellertson.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared on behalf of Mallory Davis for the State of Wisconsin by video. Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/13/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KLE and EE.

Defendant Chad M Ellertson in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Patrickus called the court and informed us that she might have Covid. Commissioner Riepenhoff granted an adjournment.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer
